w4af-version:
w4af - Web Advanced Application Attack and Audit Framework
Version: pre-alpha release
Revision: dcc7eb189b - 29 Nov 2023 16:32
Branch: main
Local changes: No
Author: The w4af team.

findings: The remote HTTP Server omitted the "server" header in its response.
The target site has a DNS wildcard configuration, the contents of "http://foobar.localhost:3000/" are equal to the ones of "http://localhost:3000/".
The content of "http://localhost:3000/" references a non existent domain: "localhost". This can be a broken link, or an internal domain name.

A robots.txt file was found at: "http://localhost:3000/robots.txt", this file might expose private URLs and requires a manual review. The scanner will add all URLs listed in this files to the analysis queue.
An operating system user directory was found at: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/"
Fingerprinted this host as a *nix system. Detection for this operating system is weak, "if not windows then linux".
The URL: "http://localhost:3000/main.js" possibly discloses US Social Security Number: "384-94-8954".

The URL "http://localhost:3000/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACE, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL

The URL "http://localhost:3000/ftp/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, OPTIONS, PIN, POLL, REPLY, RMDIR, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, VERSION_CONTROL
The URL: "http://localhost:3000/vendor.js" possibly discloses US Social Security Number: "606-17-1575".

The URL "http://localhost:3000/assets/public/" has the following allowed methods. These include DAV methods and should be disabled: *, ACL, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, CHECKOUT, COPY, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, LINK, LOCK, MERGE, MKACTIVITY, MKCOL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, MOVE, NOTIFY, OPTIONS, PATCH, PIN, POLL, POST, PROPFIND, PROPPATCH, REPLY, REPORT, RMDIR, SEARCH, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIBE, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACE, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, UNLINK, UNLOCK, UNSUBSCRIBE, VERSION_CONTROL
The URL: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/legal~.md" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/home/kali/Scanners/juice-shop/ftp/legal~.md".
The URL: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/acquisitions~.md" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/home/kali/Scanners/juice-shop/ftp/acquisitions~.md".
The URL: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/incident-support|.kdbx" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/home/kali/Scanners/juice-shop/build/routes/fileServer.js".

The URL: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/quarantine/juicy_malware_windows_64.exe|.url" has a path disclosure vulnerability which discloses "/home/kali/Scanners/juice-shop/ftp/quarantine/juicy_malware_windows_64.exe".

The URL "http://localhost:3000/ftp/quarantine/" has the following enabled HTTP methods: *, BASELINE_CONTROL, CHECKIN, DEBUG, GET, HEAD, INDEX, INVALID, INVOKE, LABEL, MKDIR, MKWORKSPACE, OPTIONS, PIN, POLL, REPLY, RMDIR, SHOWMETHOD, SPACEJUMP, SUBSCRIPTIONS, TEXTSEARCH, TRACK, UNCHECKOUT, VERSION_CONTROL

items.Name: Strange header
items.Description:
The remote web server sent 25 HTTP responses with the uncommon response header "Feature-Policy", one of the received header values is "payment 'self'". The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon header are:
 - http://localhost:3000/
 - http://localhost:3000/assets/public/favicon_js.ico
 - http://localhost:3000/assets/public/images/hackingInstructor.png
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/PuIeB
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/acquisitions.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/acquisitions~.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/announcement_encrypted.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/incident-support.kdbx

items.Name: Strange header
items.Description:
The remote web server sent 25 HTTP responses with the uncommon response header "X-Recruiting", one of the received header values is "/#/jobs". The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon header are:
 - http://localhost:3000/
 - http://localhost:3000/assets/public/favicon_js.ico
 - http://localhost:3000/assets/public/images/hackingInstructor.png
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/PuIeB
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/acquisitions.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/acquisitions~.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/announcement_encrypted.md
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/incident-support.kdbx

items.Name: Omitted server header
items.Description: The remote HTTP Server omitted the "server" header in its response. This information was found in the request with id 25.

items.Name: DNS wildcard
items.Description: The target site has a DNS wildcard configuration, the contents of "http://foobar.localhost:3000/" are equal to the ones of "http://localhost:3000/". This information was found in the requests with ids 24 and 56.

items.Name: Internal hostname in HTML link
items.Description: The content of "http://localhost:3000/" references a non existent domain: "localhost". This can be a broken link, or an internal domain name. This information was found in the request with id 261.

items.Name: robots.txt file
items.Description: A robots.txt file was found at: "http://localhost:3000/robots.txt", this file might expose private URLs and requires a manual review. The scanner will add all URLs listed in this files to the analysis queue. This information was found in the request with id 90.

items.Name: Interesting META tag
items.Description:
The application sent a <meta> tag with the attribute value set to "width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, maximum-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no" which looks interesting and should be manually reviewed. The first ten URLs which sent the tag are:
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/
 - http://localhost:3000/ftp/quarantine

items.Name: Web user home directory
items.Description: An operating system user directory was found at: "http://localhost:3000/ftp/".  This information was found in the request with id 381.

items.Name: Strange HTTP response code
items.Description:
The remote web server sent 1 HTTP responses with the uncommon response status code 204 using "No Content" as message. The first ten URLs which sent the uncommon status code are:
 - http://localhost:3000/assets/public/

items.Name: Operating system
items.Description: Fingerprinted this host as a *nix system. Detection for this operating system is weak, "if not windows then linux". This information was found in the requests with ids 429 and 440.

items.Name: US Social Security Number disclosure
items.Description: The URL: "http://localhost:3000/main.js" possibly discloses US Social Security Number: "384-94-8954". This vulnerability was found in the request with id 512.
